page.title: 03Industry in Tadcaster
page.content: Tadcaster has two main{industries, {brewing}and limestone{quarrying.}There are three breweries, Samuel Smith's, (founded in 1768), John Smith's and Bass Charrington's. Tadcaster is a good place for making beer because it has hard water, and other things required such as sugar beet and barley are grown close by. In turn the breweries help the{farmers}by producing cattle cake. The beer which is made is sent all over the country. The stone taken from the quarries is limestone and local quarries produced the stone of which York Minster is built. There are three quarries currently working to produce building stone and roadstone.
